original: Candrasūtra
analyzed: candrasūtra
translated: Candrasūtra

original: eva mayā śrutam / ekasamaya bhagavā capāyā viharati gargarapuṣkariṇyās tīre /
analyzed: eva mayā śrutam eka samaya bhagavā capāyāḥ viharati gargarapuṣkariṇyāḥ tīre
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time the Blessed One was dwelling on the bank of the Garga Pond.

original: tena khalu samayena rāhuṇā asurendreṇa sarva candramaṇḍalam āvṛta /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena rāhuṇā asura indreṇa sarva candra maṇḍalam āvṛta
translated: At that time, the entire lunar sphere was enveloped by Rāhu, the lord of the asuras.

original: atha yā devatā tasmi candramaṇḍale sthitā bhītā trastā savignā hṛṣṭaromakūpā yena
analyzed: atha yā devatā candra maṇḍale sthitā bhītā trastā sa vignā hṛṣṭa romakūpā yena
translated: Then the deity who was dwelling in that lunar sphere, frightened, terrified, anxious, with hair standing on end, approached

original: bhagavās tenopajagāma / upetya bhagavatpādau śirasā vanditvaikānte sthāt / ekāntasthitā
analyzed: bhagavān tena upajagāma upetya bhagavat pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte sthāt ekānta sthitā
translated: the Blessed One. Having approached, she bowed her head at the feet of the Blessed One and stood to one side. Standing to one side,

original: bhagavata gāthayā babhāṣe /🔽namas te buddha vīrāstu vipramuktāya savataḥ /
analyzed: bhagavata gāthayā babhāṣe  namaḥ te buddha vīra astu vipramuktāya savataḥ
translated: she spoke this verse to the Blessed One:🔽Homage to you, O Buddha, the hero, the one liberated from all bonds.

original: sabādhapratipanno smi tasya me śaraṇa bhava //
analyzed: sabādha pratipannaḥ smi tasya me śaraṇa bhava
translated: I am beset by obstacles, be my refuge.

original: loke sugatam arhanta candramāḥ śaraṇa gataḥ /
analyzed: loke sugatam arhanta candramāḥ śaraṇa gataḥ
translated: In the world, the Sugata, the Arhat, the moon has gone for refuge.

original: rāhoś candramasa muñca buddhā lokānukapakāḥ //
analyzed: rāhoḥ candramasa muñca buddhāḥ loka anukapakāḥ
translated: Release the moon from Rāhu, the Buddhas have compassion for the world.

original: bhagavā gāthayā pratyābhāṣīt /
analyzed: bhagavā gāthayā pratyābhāṣīt
translated: The Blessed One replied with this verse:

original: yo hy andhakāre nabhasi
analyzed: yaḥ hi andhakāre nabhasi
translated: He who in the sky, in the darkness,

original: prabhākaro vairocano /
analyzed: prabhākaraḥ vairocanaḥ
translated: is the illuminator, the Vairocana,

original: rāho śaśāṅka grasa māntarīkṣe
analyzed: rāho śaśāṅka grasa mā antarīkṣe
translated: Rāhu, having swallowed the moon in the sky,

original: prajāpradīpa tvarita vimuñca //
analyzed: prajā pradīpa tvarita vimuñca
translated: quickly release the lamp of the people.

original: sasvinnagātro vyathitaḥ sabādhito yathā naraḥ / satvaramāṇo sau rāhuś candramaṇḍalam utsṛṣṭaḥ //
analyzed: sa svid gātraḥ vyathitaḥ sa bādh yathā naraḥ sa tvaramāṇa rāhuḥ candra maṇḍalam utsṛṣṭaḥ
translated: With his body sweating, distressed, and obstructed, like a man, Rāhu quickly released the lunar orb.

original: tena samayena baḍir virocanapautra āsīd asuraḥ / adrākṣīd baḍir virocanapautro rāhuṇā asurendreṇa tvaritatvarita candramaṇḍalam utsṛṣṭam
analyzed: tena samayena baḍiḥ virocana pautraḥ āsīt asuraḥ adrākṣīt baḍiḥ virocana pautraḥ rāhuṇā asura indreṇa candra maṇḍalam utsṛṣṭam  /
translated: At that time, there was an asura named Bṛihajjyotiṣa, the grandson of Virūpākṣa. Bṛihajjyotiṣa saw Rāhu, the lord of the asuras, quickly releasing the lunar orb.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca tasyā velāyā gāthā babhāṣe //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca tasyāḥ velāyāḥ gāthāḥ babhāṣe
translated: Having seen it, at that time he spoke this verse:

original: ki nu satvaramāṇas tva rāhuś candra vimuñcasi / sasvinnagātro vyathitaḥ sabādhito yathā naraḥ //
analyzed: ki nu sa tvaramāṇaḥ tva rāhuḥ candra vimuñcasi sa svinna gātraḥ vyathitaḥ sa bādhitaḥ yathā naraḥ
translated: Why are you releasing the moon so quickly, Rāhu, with your body sweating, distressed, and obstructed, like a man?

original: rāhur avocat // saptadhā me sphalen mūrdhā jīvan na sukham āpnuyā tatra buddhābhigītena muñceya śaśina na cet //
analyzed: rāhuḥ avocat saptadhā me sphalet mūrdhā jīvan na sukham tatra buddha abhigītena muñceya śaśina na ced
translated: Rāhu said: If I do not release the moon with a verse sung by the Buddha, my head will split into seven pieces, and I will not attain happiness while alive.

original: baḍir virocanapautra gāthayā babhāṣe //
analyzed: baḍiḥ virocana pautra gāthayā babhāṣe
translated: Bṛihajjyotiṣa, the grandson of Virūpākṣa, spoke this verse:

original: madarśinaḥ sabuddhāḥ /
analyzed: madarśinaḥ sabuddhāḥ
translated: The Buddhas have not seen this.

original: teṣā gāthābhigītena rāhuś candra vimuñcati //
analyzed: teṣā gāthā abhigītena rāhuḥ candra vimuñcati
translated: Rāhu releases the moon with a verse sung by them.

original: candrasūtra samāptam //
analyzed: candrasūtra samāptam
translated: The Moon Sutra is completed.
